DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to find out the predictability of the pulse pressure variation during spontaneous ventilation on the incidence of hypotension during induction of anesthesia.
DOC.brief_title: Predictability of the Pulse Pressure Variation (PPV) During Spontaneous Ventilation on the Incidence of Hypotension During Induction of Anesthesia
DOC.criteria: Patients undergoing general anesthesia induction with intravenous anesthesia using propofol and remifentanil Patients requiring invasive arterial blood pressure monitoring for the surgery Refusal of consent Patients with heart disease (symptomatic valvular heart disease, intracardiac shunt, pulmonary hypertension with pulmonary systolic arterial pressure exceeding 40mmHg) FEV1 â‰¤ 50% predicted FEV1 Patients with chronic renal failure ASA class IV, V, VI Systolic arterial blood pressure below 90mmHg before induction of anesthesia
